text: Tore Klas Agne Simonsson (19 October 1935 – 22 September 2020) was a Swedish footballer. He played as a striker. Beginning his career with Örgryte IS, he went on to represent Real Madrid and Real Sociedad in La Liga in the early 1960s before returning to Örgryte in 1963. Simonsson won 51 caps for the Sweden national team. He was a part of the Sweden team that finished second at the 1958 FIFA World Cup. He was the recipient of the 1959 Svenska Dagbladet Gold Medal. Simonsson died on 22 September 2020 from pneumonia in Gothenburg at the age of 84.Fallece Simonsson, delantero sueco que jugó en la Real en los 60 cedido por el Madrid ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Swedish footballers Category:Swedish football managers Category:Sportspeople from Gothenburg
title: Agne Simonsson
